message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC. 

The paper proposes a deep learning-based approach to evaluate the readability of graph layouts by directly using graph images. This involves the use of convolutional neural networks, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks such as image classification and object detection. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. 

The paper also focuses on graph layout algorithms and readability metrics, which are related to graph theory and graph drawing. Therefore, cs.GR (Graphics) is also a likely sub-category. 

The proposed approach involves training a neural network on a benchmark dataset of graph images, which is a common approach in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another likely sub-category. 

The paper also compares the proposed approach to traditional methods and evaluates it qualitatively by showing usage scenarios and visualizing convolutional layers, which are related to machine learning and data analysis. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible sub-category. 

Finally, the paper aims to improve the readability of graph layouts, which is related to human-computer interaction and user experience. Therefore, cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is another possible sub-category.
